com.amlibtech.util
Class LaDate

java.lang.Object
  com.amlibtech.util.LaDate
public class LaDate
extends java.lang.Object

Long Absolute Date : using the Gregorian calendar, and assuming it has been used since the' start of the common era, an LaDate.value is the number of days since 01/01/0000. It knows about leap years and leap centuries. It dones NOT revert to the julian calandar at any time. It does not handle negative dates. I.E. no BC Dates. Days Date 0 01/01/0000 9 01/10/0000 99 04/09/0000 999 09/26/0002 9999 05/18/0027 99999 10/15/0273 999999 11/27/2737 9999999 01/25/27379

from_Gregorian_10mdcy

public static LaDate from_Gregorian_10mdcy(java.lang.String date_str)
                                    throws Bad_Date_Exception
Creates a Long_Absolute_Date from the Gregorian Date in a String of 10 characters. i.e. mm/dd/ccyy, 12/25/2004

Throws:
Bad_Date_Exception

from_Gregorian_8mdy

public static LaDate from_Gregorian_8mdy(java.lang.String date_str)
                                  throws Bad_Date_Exception
Creates a Long_Absolute_Date from the Gregorian Date in a String of 8 characters. i.e. mm/dd/yy, 12/25/04 the century is assumed to be 19.

Throws:
Bad_Date_Exception

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts a Long_Absolute_Date to the Gregorian Date in a String of 10 characters. i.e. mm/dd/ccyy, 12/25/2004 see to_Gregorian_10mdcy()
